title: Vote of no confidence dismisses Prime Minister

content.question: Which of the following can be considered a fundamental feature of parliamentary government?

choices.label: The head of government and the head of state are unified into one position.
The head of government is directly elected in a national election.
The head of government can be dismissed through a vote of no confidence in the assembly.
The head of government can dismiss the head of state through a vote of no confidence.
The head of state appoints cabinet members.

content.answer: The head of government can be dismissed through a vote of no confidence in the assembly.

skill.text: Skill 1.A: Describe political systems, principles, institutions, processes, policies, and behaviors.
